report_title: Industry Research: Handyman Services in the US
executive_summary: Handymen have seen a dramatic shift in trends and drivers, influenced heavily by the pandemic and economic fluctuations. As homeowners found themselves limited from spending on travel and dining out because of lockdown measures, many invested in their homes instead, bolstering growth. However, recent interest rate hikes and declining consumer confidence have dampened this growth trajectory, causing a dip in new home improvement investments.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Home Improvement Trends Supported Handymen During the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Home investment skyrocketed during the pandemic after lockdown measures. Consumers had fewer spending options, with the pandemic ruling out travel and dining out. Instead, homeowners invested in boosting the value of and improving their homes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rate Hikes Subdued Growth from Housing and Commercial Real Estate Markets
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Interest rate hikes and poor consumer confidence have discouraged homeowners and commercial real estate managers from investing in new projects and nonessential alterations in 2022 and 2023.

Clients weigh quality and timeliness with price when choosing a handyman. As economic conditions, especially consumer confidence, sour, homeowners have increasingly sacrificed strong reputations and well-known brands for better deals.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Independent Handymen and Nonemployers Have Struggled to Gain New Clients
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Larger companies and franchised handymen have a clear advantage over independent handymen and non-employers, especially regarding brand reputation, name recognition, service diversity and availability.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Websites and Apps Will Become a Differentiating Factor
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many larger companies have started creating new websites and apps to make booking easier for potential clients from start to finish. These systems often include online booking and time-to-arrival/tracking.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Handymen Will Benefit From Rebounding Construction Markets
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Construction markets will recover over the next five years, especially as the Federal Reserve continues to cut interest rate levels. Improving consumer confidence will also support the performance of handymen.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Aging Housing Stock in the United States Will Support Handymen
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: According to the latest data available from the US Census Bureau's Annual Housing Survey, the median age of an owner-occupied home is 37 years old, compared with only 29 years old in 2001. With an aging housing stock, homeowners will spend more on repairs and maintenance.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Some Threats May Impact the Growth of Handymen
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: People will spend less time at home compared to the past five years, potentially spending more money on travel and dining out instead of home improvement. Falling homeownership rates will also compound sluggish home improvement spending.

industry_definition: Handymen perform work involving the skills of two or more maintenance or craft occupations to keep machines, mechanical equipment or the structure of a building in repair. Duties may involve pipe fitting; HVAC maintenance; insulating; welding; machining; carpentry; repairing electrical or mechanical equipment; installing, aligning and balancing new equipment; and repairing buildings, floors or stairs.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Companies depend on word-of-mouth advertising to attract new clients and maintain a stable revenue stream.
Consistency and balance are crucial for success. Achieving this balance ensures long-term growth and solidifies customer trust.
Handymen must offer competitive prices in a heavily saturated industry. Clients now have significant pricing power.

Handymen thrived on pandemic-era home improvement trends, but rising interest rates and low consumer confidence have recently stymied growth. A recovery is expected in 2024 thanks to improving consumer confidence and potential interest rate cuts.
Fragmentation is high among handymen with no dominant companies. Most handymen are nonemployers, operating locally and relying on word-of-mouth for new clients.
Handymen need certifications and licenses to operate. The requirements differ significantly across states and municipalities.
Most full-time handymen join trade associations. These groups offer private support, but the industry lacks public backing.
Handymen must obtain licenses and insurance, adding to their costs. These costs vary by state and significantly impact their business expenses.
Wage costs have increased, impacting profitability. Companies depend on skilled labor, but shortages have driven up wages.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Declining homeownership and high mortgage rates lead to more robust demand from real estate, rental and leasing markets
Homeowners represent the majority of demand
Business from commercial and other clients has been volatile
Business from commercial and other clients has been volatile

products_and_services.product_description: Plumbing services are mostly nondiscretionary and steady
Painting and interior work faces DIY threats
Flooring, tile and carpet projects face less competition from DIY consumers
Growth in outdoor projects has dominated other services

tier_1_suppliers: Tool & Hardware Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Power Tools & Other General Purpose Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Real Estate and Rental and Leasing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Private spending on home improvements is crucial for handyman services. The necessity of many repair projects makes this spending relatively stable despite economic fluctuations.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest population, driving a greater need for services.
Handymen service providers are primarily located in the Mid-Atlantic region, which accounts for over 17.0% of employment.
Employment in the handyman sector in the Great Lakes regions hovers around 15.0%.
Employment in the handyman sector in the West region hovers around 15.0%.
The Southwest shows growing demand, particularly from retiring demographics.
The Rocky M region has the lowest percentage of both establishments (around 2%) and population (around 5%).

regulations_points.regulation_description: State and local regulations significantly impact handymen, with many areas requiring insurance and licenses.
Companies must comply with general labor laws regarding minimum wage and workplace conditions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The primary legal barrier to entry for handymen is obtaining and renewing certifications.
These certifications vary by state, making cross-state operations challenging for small businesses.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies depend on word-of-mouth advertising to attract new clients and maintain a stable revenue stream.
Reputation and consistency are crucial for success.
Handymen must offer competitive prices in a heavily saturated industry.
Recent business slowdowns have intensified price competition.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The majority of handymen operate as nonemployers.
Most companies can't manage the logistics associated with a national brand.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Handymen must attain and renew several licenses.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: These regulations often vary by state and chosen specialties.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Many handymen also pay franchising fees to operate under a brand name.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Most franchises also have an initial franchise fee.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Handymen must purchase equipment and tools needed for repair and maintenance services.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: These purchases often include ladders and hammers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: In most situations, handymen are responsible for material purchases.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: For example, if a client requests a handyman to paint a room, the business must purchase the primer.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: These purchases also include any subcontracted labor.
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Many larger businesses hire other handymen on a per-project basis.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Most handymen take on traditionally seasonal jobs.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Many companies offer customers online booking online options.
Handyman services providers have also started online marketing and advertising.
While most handymen still heavily rely on word-of-mouth advertising.

FAQs.question: Does your company primarily work with residential or non-residential construction markets?
FAQs.answer: Residential construction is the largest market for the industry.

FAQs.question: Does your company work to anticipate changes in sales based on current market performance?
FAQs.answer: Demand for handyman services is largely dependent on activity in the residential construction sector.

FAQs.question: Does your company make use of subcontractors to save on wage costs? Roughly, what percent of revenue is consumed by wages?
FAQs.answer: Subcontracted work is accounted for as a purchase cost.

FAQs.question: What is the size of your staff? How does that compare to your competitors?
FAQs.answer: The industry is dominated by a large number of small companies.

FAQs.question: Have productivity issues ever kept you from winning lucrative contracts over larger competitors?
FAQs.answer: The most efficient companies win lucrative contracts.

FAQs.question: Investment in new technology is fairly low among builders and contractors. How much does your company invest in new equipment annually?
FAQs.answer: Companies must adapt to any advancements and changes.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met on and off the construction site?
FAQs.answer: There are strict health and safety requirements that all handymen must follow.

FAQs.question: Has complying with new energy-efficiency rules in various building codes driven up costs? How has your company offset these increases?
FAQs.answer: Complying with new energy-efficiency rules has not significantly driven up costs for companies.

FAQs.question: How many of your clients are return customers?
FAQs.answer: For individual companies, customer loyalty is crucial to sustaining demand.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit compare with your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Generally, profit varies slightly between larger and smaller companies.

FAQs.question: Are you known for your reliability and performance? Have you had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: Maintaining a reputation for quality and timeliness is critical for the success of handymen.

FAQs.question: How do companies attract new markets?
FAQs.answer: Most handyman businesses are nonemployers limiting their scope.

FAQs.question: Do handymen benefit from joining a franchise?
FAQs.answer: Franchisees often have an advantage over non-employers.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of inflation and access to credit? Has your company taken advantage of current interest rate trends?
FAQs.answer: Access to credit refers to a business or organization's ability to borrow money from a lending institution.

FAQs.question: Which of your products has been the most resilient to fluctuations in demand in the wake of the pandemic? Do you offer any discount products?
FAQs.answer: Per capital disposable income drives revenue.

FAQs.question: How is private spending on home improvements expected to fair in 2023?
FAQs.answer: Private spending on home improvements is a key driver for this industry.
